title: The narrative theories of Hayden White and Hans Kellner provide a helpful lens through which to understand how the Lives limit the meaning of cross-dressing. These historiographers help us see how narratives impose a singular and coherent structure on a multivalent and “chaotic” reality, selectively choosing singular interpretive frames that obscure other possibilities.
